sentences.english: It's got a new government, you know, which hasn't governed before.
sentences.chinese: 它剛換了政府，一個從未執政過的新政府。

sentences.english: And Trump's governing concept shows a strong inclination toward neo-isolationism.
sentences.chinese: 從其執政理念看，新孤立主義傾向明顯。

sentences.english: Muammar al-Qaddafi, making his first appearance despite 40 years in power.
sentences.chinese: 這也是卡扎菲執政40年來首次參加聯大會議。

sentences.english: President John Kufuor is retiring after eight years in office.
sentences.chinese: 加納總統庫福爾在執政8年後將退休。

sentences.english: The MMD’s lengthy tenure may have lulled China into a false sense of security.
sentences.chinese: MMD的長期執政可能給了中國一種錯誤的安全觀。

sentences.english: It is the striking theme of the ruling history and country history that people are the masters.
sentences.chinese: 人民當家作主成爲黨的執政史和國史的鮮明主題。

sentences.english: They seem to make better proposals when they are out of office than when they are in power.
sentences.chinese: 他們似乎下野時比執政時能提出更好的建議。

sentences.english: Will he govern for people, or for automobiles?
sentences.chinese: 他執政爲民，還是執政爲汽車公司？

sentences.english: Will he govern for people, or for automobiles?
sentences.chinese: 他執政爲民，還是執政爲汽車公司？

sentences.english: The 16th National Party Congress put forward for strengthen the party's ability to govern.
sentences.chinese: 黨的十六屆四中全會提出加強黨的執政能力建設。

sentences.english: He wanted to form an all-party government of national unity.
sentences.chinese: 他想成立一個維護國家團結的多黨執政政府。

sentences.english: The legionaries, on their victorious return, refused any longer to obey the consuls.
sentences.chinese: 軍團士兵在凱旋歸國時，不肯服從執政官的命令。

sentences.english: Police stations and offices of the ruling National Democratic Party were on fire across the country.
sentences.chinese: 全國各地的警局和執政黨黨部被焚燒。

sentences.english: Do you knohen the first Chinese empress came to power?
sentences.chinese: 你知道中國第一位女皇帝是什麼時候上臺執政的嗎？

sentences.english: The improvement of the work style of the party in power means its life and death.
sentences.chinese: ⑴執政黨的黨風建設關係到它的生死存亡。

sentences.english: And a clutch of counter-terrorism laws that were widely abused under Mr Mubarak will be revoked.
sentences.chinese: 一些在穆巴拉克執政期間廣泛濫用的反恐法也將廢除。

definition: DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
